Taxes

Explanatory notes for the following statistics:
47415 Structural survey of service activities

Definition:
Business taxes and other public charges:
Taxes which are unrequited payments levied by general
government or by the institutions of the European Union in
respect of the procurement and importation of goods as well
as the procurement and provision of services, the employment
of labour, the ownership or use of land, buildings or other
assets used in the business process. This includes in
particular trade tax, motor vehicle tax, real property tax
and excise duties levied on own-account produced goods (e.g.
electricity and energy tax).
Other public charges include public fees and contributions
to be paid for specific services provided by general
government.
